Instructors

Hatef Monajemi

David Donoho

Massive Computational Experiments, Painlessly

Stanford University, Fall 2017

This course covers state-of-the-art practices for doing million-CPU-hour computational experiments on the cloud in a pain-free and reproducible manner. In addition to giving students a hands-on experience with cluster computing, the course features few guest lectures by renowned scientists in the field of Data Science.

TA

TA

These are notes for Stanford course Massive Computational Experiments, Painlessly (MCEP). For questions/concerns/bug reports, please contact Hatef Monajemi or David Donoho.

Topics

  1. Basics
    • Bash Tutorial
    • Perl Tutorial
    • Computing Resources at Stanford
  2. Reproducibility
    • Literature
    • Containers
    • CodaLab
  3. ClusterJob (CJ)
    • MATLAB jobs
    • Python jobs
    • R jobs
  4. CJ for Deep Learning
    • PyTorch
